reviewText: This is an excellent, EXCELLENT, rendition of the French novel, Dangerous Liasons. The actor is superb in denoting his cynicism, well, all the actors/actresses are superb and the directing even more so. Aside from the story itself, we are presented to early 19th century Korean culture and the strict segregation of the sexes made the plot of the novel/book even more of a challenge. I'm going to buy this movie!

reviewText: I bought this because I like Bae Yong Jun. I have no quarrel with the sexual content, but for some reason I can't fathom I found this film boring.

reviewText: I only gave it 5 stars because there are not more stars available but this movie deserves much more than just 5. GORGEOUS, VERY GLAMOROUS AND EXTREMELY SEXY!!!!!!!!!!! In my inexpert eyes it is a MASTERPIECE!!!!!!!!!! I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I got seduced by Cho-won and fell in love with him just like the girl in the movie did and grieved when he died although I am familiar with the story and the fate of the characters from previous movies based on the same novel. I own and adore Stephen Frears Dangerous Liaisons with John Malkovich and Glenn Close that I also recommend if you have not seen it but definitely this Korean version is SUBLIME, UNIQUE and I am madly in love with it!!!! Now I own it!!!!!Untold Scandal
summary: GORGEOUS, VERY GLAMOROUS AND EXTREMELY SEXY

reviewText: Many, many years ago, I saw "Dangerous Liaisons" with John Malkovich and Glen Close.  When I saw this film on shelves, I could not resist to see the Korean version of the story.  Needless to say, I was not disappointed at all.  I like foreign movies, so subtitles, are never an issue for me.  But what really gives this film beauty is wonderful costumes, make up and jewelry that depict the members of the Korean high society froma couple of centuries ago.  Visually this film is very pleasing and in spite of the story's original european roots, it manages to keep its own sensuality intact.  Every character is carefully developed and plot pretty much stays its course.  It is definitely kind of a classic movie that can be told in any culture and still find its audience.  Real delight, I strongly recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Because it's so hard to describe movies with out giving them away I'm going to compare this one to "Original Sin."  If you enjoy emotion and sexuality that will throw you for a loop and make you feel turned on, happy, and then sad and scream "whyyyyyy!" at the TV and characters then this is the epitome of that in Korea.  You will honestly feel sorry for some one in the movie, call another character a straight "c*nt" and watch a character or two evolve into some pretty noble.  You know what, mix "Original Sin" with "Cruel Intentions" and that's pretty close to what it is, but not the teen version of cruel intentions.  This is the adult version, not just because of overt sexuality and beautiful Korean women in a wonderful setting but also because it would take a life time to come up with the evil games they play.  The rest you'll have to see for yourself but it is indeed a very good movie.
summary: Absolutely gut wrenching...in a good way.

reviewText: Untold Scandal was in my opinion okay. I wouldn't say I hate it but I didn't love it.  Some parts were pretty good but overall it lacked the spark that makes you watch without allowing yourself to be interrupted.
